message: Let's be reasonable, Bob.  Every round we wait costs us money.
I appreciate the offer, Alice, but I think this split is more reflective of the decreasing value over time.  Let's make a deal!
Bob, my offer is still generous.  We both lose out if this drags on.
Alice, we're halfway through the rounds and not making progress. I'm coming down on my share, let's settle this before we both lose out.
Bob, this is getting ridiculous.  I'm being more than fair, let's end this now and both walk away with something substantial.
Alice, I'm willing to negotiate, but you need to realize your share is losing value quickly.  This is a compromise, take it before it's too late!
Bob, this is my final offer. Take it, or I'm walking away.  Don't be greedy.
Alice, you were right to call me out on being greedy. Let's end this on a fair note. This offer acknowledges the time pressure and gives us both a good deal. Take it and we can both walk away happy.
